vision.title: üéØ Project Vision
vision.p1: OpenBaccarat is dedicated to creating a transparent, fair, and verifiable baccarat gaming platform. We believe that through open-source code and blockchain technology, every user can trust the fairness of the game.
vision.p2: This is not a gambling platform, but a technical demonstration project, aimed at showing how to build trustworthy gaming systems using modern technology.

basic.title: Basic Rules
basic.rule2: Player and Banker each receive 2-3 cards
basic.rule4: 10, J, Q, K count as 0 points, A counts as 1 point
basic.rule5: Total points use only the ones digit (e.g., 15 = 5 points)

drawing.title: Drawing Rules
drawing.rule1: If either side has 8 or 9 (Natural), neither draws
drawing.rule2: Player draws on 0-5 points, stands on 6-7
drawing.rule3: Banker drawing depends on Player's third card

burning.title: Burning Rules
burning.rule1: At opening, burn cards based on first card value
burning.rule2: Reserve 14-16 cards at shoe end (not dealt)

vrfExplain.title: üé≤ VRF Random Verification
vrfExplain.p1: OpenBaccarat uses Verifiable Random Function (VRF) to ensure game fairness. Each round's random numbers come with cryptographic proofs that anyone can verify.
vrfExplain.step1: Get VRF proof and public key
vrfExplain.step2: Use open-source verification tools to check proof
vrfExplain.step3: Confirm random numbers correspond to game results
vrfExplain.step4: Verify dealing sequence follows the rules

faq.title: ‚ùì FAQ
faq.q1: Where to find the transaction signature?
faq.a1: After each game round, click the "View" link in the history records to see the corresponding transaction signature.
faq.a2: Please check if the signature is copied correctly. If the problem persists, the transaction may not be confirmed yet due to network delay, please try again later.
faq.a3: All code is open source, random numbers are verifiable, results are recorded on-chain and immutable. Technical audits are welcome.
